SENT.plain: Medullary dysplasia may be present in the kidneys of children with the Beckwith-Wiedemann Syndrome (BWS)

This is usually visible only at the microscopic level, but superimposed pyelonephritis in a child with the BWS led to gross changes that produced a filling defect on CT scanning of the remaining kidney
The finding could have been misinterpreted as a metachronous wilms tumor
